snippet: John O. Brennan called allegations by Mitt Romney and other Republicans “irresponsible,” and said there needed to be leeway for legitimate efforts to inform the public.
abstract: John O Brennan, President Obama’s top counterterrorism adviser, bluntly rejects charges from Mitt Romney and other Republicans that the White House has leaked classified information for political purposes; says critics are conflating unauthorized disclosures that do real harm with legitimate government efforts to inform the public.
lead_paragraph: John O. Brennan called allegations by Mitt Romney and other Republicans “irresponsible,” and said there needed to be leeway for legitimate efforts to inform the public.

headline.seo: Counterterrorism Adviser John Brennan Rebukes Critics of Leaks
headline.main: Rebuking Critics of Leaks, Top Counterterrorism Adviser Seeks a Little Room
headline.print_headline: Rebuking Critics of Leaks, Top Counterterror Adviser Seeks a Little Room
